item.title: Why Sql Is Important?
item.description: When I started programming professionally, I somehow decided that knowing SQL wasn’t necessary at all. For complex questions, there were DBAs, and for simple ones, there were ORMs. SQL seemed too arcane, evoking images of mainframes and punch cards. Then, various NoSQL solutions from CouchDB to MongoDB gained popularity, and I happily switched to document-oriented databases, once again mistakenly deciding that SQL was outdated and not worth my time. A few years later, I evolved into a DevOps and SRE specialist and concluded that I would never need SQL…
